abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say third of primary care doctors and nurses in United States remain unaware that taking antiretroviral drug Truvada can protect patients almost completely from getting HIV.
lead_paragraph: Federal health officials announced that a third of doctors and nurses have not heard of Truvada, which can prevent H.I.V. infection.

headline.main: Many Doctors Unaware of Truvada, Drug for Preventing H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: National Briefing| Many Doctors Remain Unaware of Drug That Helps Prevent H.I.V. Transmission

snippet: Federal health officials announced that a third of doctors and nurses have not heard of Truvada, which can prevent H.I.V. infection.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
